name: Ibrahim Abuimeir
info: Ibrahim Abuimeir: Abuimeir, a 21-year-old Palestinian footballer, escaped death on the 30th October 2023, after “an air strike hit his neighbour's home and destroyed his home”. Even after such devasting, traumatic events, Abuimeir still risked his life to “pull his grandparents out of a rubble”.  Abuimeir’s strength, power and selflessness mean that he is a perfect choice for my fantasy team. As a centre back Abuimeir’s resistance is essential throughout such a competitive game. Not only this but, Abuimeir would make an exceptional captain, because already his morals and actions, closely reflect values of sportsmanship.

name: Hamza Choudhury
info: Hamza Choudhury: During the 2021 FA cup-final Choudhury outwardly showed his support for Palestine. Choudhury, who plays for Leicester showed his solidatory with Palestine by flying the Palestinian flag high whilst celebrating his victory. His defensive position on the pitch, is also translated off the pitch, by defending Palestine at such a prolific event in the sporting world. As Choudhury defends Palestine so openly, particularly within the Western world, it shows his fearlessness, making him a great asset to my fantasy team as a right back.

name: Sami Al-Da’our
info: Sami Al-Da’our: Al-Da’our, despite being retired, takes the spot of midfield in my fantasy team. After he was subject to arrest in 2016, when his house was raided, Al-Da’our livelihood was diminished. As an attacker, on the pitch, it is heart-breaking that off the pitch, he is the one being attacked, Al-Da’our becomes vulnerable. Typically, an attacker is focused and domineering, the pivotal part of a team, someone you rely on to take you to victory. With these qualities, his arrest was a time to stand strong and withstand pressure to make it over the line.
